entry.title: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 8:37AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON ALONG THE LOWER KUSKOKWIM RIVER... * WHAT...Flooding caused by storm surge is expected. * WHERE...The lower Kuskokwim River, including Bethel, Napakiak, and other nearby villages. * WHEN...Until 345 PM AKDT Sunday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 2:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Heavy Rain and Rising River Levels This Weekend... Moderate to heavy rainfall will continue to fall over the Seward Peninsula and western Brooks Range, as the remnants of post- tropical typhoon Merbok track northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Expect three-day rainfall totals around 3 inches at Red Dog Mine, around 5 inches in the peaks of the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:50AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Lingering Smoke Today, Cooler and Wetter through Wednesday... * Smoke impacts from the Mosquito Fire today are anticipated to be similar to what was experienced Saturday. The densest smoke will be directed into the Sierra Valley-Portola areas, arching east across Pyramid Lake and into west central Nevada overnight into Monday morning. entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Flood Warning issued September 18 at 2:18PM EDT until September 19 at 4:24AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Tampa Bay Ruskin FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following county, Miami-Dade. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued September 18 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Another round of strong to severe thunderstorms is expected late this afternoon and evening over southeast Iowa. Yesterday between 4 and 5 inches fell over much of of southern and southeast Iowa. Though not a certainty, some areas may receive another 2 to 3 inches of rainfall which could lead to flooding in poor drainage urban areas or low-lying areas.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:19AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Gusty south winds expected through Tuesday... A slow moving and strong low pressure system off of the northern California coast will bring gusty south winds to much of Nevada today as well as Monday and Tuesday. entry.title: Coastal Flood Warning issued September 18 at 9:30AM ADT until September 19 at 7:00AM ADT by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AST MONDAY... * WHAT...Coastal flooding associated with Tropical Storm Fiona. * WHERE...Southern and southeastern coasts of Puerto Rico. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Water levels of 1 to 3 feet above ground level. Heavy surf and beach erosion.

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued September 18 at 2:51AM MDT until September 19 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .Unseasonably warm temperatures are expected Monday. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 9:59AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today for portions of the Coastal Bend and portions of the western Brush Country. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored
